intro: Cujunia grandiflora var. sordida, commonly known as the sordid large-flowered cujunia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its foliage is broad and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental appeal in botanical gardens.
